climbs.name: Snelled Hook
climbs.fa: Brad Singer, Pete Paredes & Bill Olszewski, June 2007

content.description: Snelled Hook starts about 5' right of Hook and Ladder and climbs plates to the top, sharing the last two bolts with El Gancho.  Similar to Hook and Ladder but on smaller, more challenging edges with a reachy crux down low.  Rappel or walk left to descend.
content.protection: 3 bolts, bolted anchor shared with Hook and Ladder

climbs.name: Hook, Line and Singer
climbs.fa: Brad Singer and Pete Paredes, September 2007

content.description: Start at the bolt left of the easy section, do a fun move to the ledge/stance/what-have-you (you could dodge this by climbing the easy rock immediately to the right, but it's not the crux anyway..). Next move up onto the real face, do some tricky moves right, and some tricky moves back left. All around a good time.
content.location: Next route to the right of "By Hook or By Crook," can access top anchors by walking to the top of the rock, as with all routes here.

content.description: Hook and Ladder climbs the left end of the south face of Peyronie's Wall.  Start just right of a separate block and go up and left over large plates to the top.  Using the block to start may downgrade the climb by one point.  Short but fun.  Rappel or walk left to descend.
content.protection: 3 bolts, bolted anchor shared with Snelled Hook
content.location: This is the left-most line on Peyronie's Wall.

content.description: Although you may be tempted to jump on this one from just right of Snelled Hook, you'd be missing some of the best climbing on this route as El Gancho is an interesting mix of slab, crack and face climbing.  Scramble down the notch towards the start of By Hook or Crook.  Climb the slab past a bolt to gain the short crack.  The crux comes while working the crack up to plates on the right.  Top out with an easy finish on large plates.  Rappel or walk left to descend.
content.protection: 4 bolts, bolted anchor shared with By Hook or Crook
content.location: This is the third bolt line, counting from the climber's left.

climbs.name: Captain Hook
climbs.fa: Pete Paredes, Loren Scott and Brad Singer July 2007

content.description: Start by climbing up the rock, clip some bolts then do some neat-o lieback moves. All around a good time.
content.location: Immediately right of Hook, Line and Sinker

content.description: By Hook or Crook is another very interesting climb.  Start in a grotty offwidth on the right end of Peyronie's Wall.  From the top of the crack, transition right through a delicate, sequential and strenuous crux, ending with a fun move to gain purchase atop the rail.  Easy climbing on thin holds takes you to the top.  Rappel or walk left to descend.
content.protection: 5 bolts, bolted anchor shared with El Gancho
content.location: Climbs the southeast arete of Peyronie's Wall.
